sections: Time is running out, get your extra entries as a Motorious reader now!

Precious few people have been able to get behind the wheel of the C8 Corvette, thanks to production shortages fueled by shutdowns. While that’s certainly unfortunate, the good news is the C8 generation has only started, so you obviously have plenty more chances to try one out. With Elkhart Blue Metallic paint, this American sports car is certainly dressed to impress. Everyone will absolutely be jealous of this ride and can you blame them?

for breathtaking performance. A 6.2-liter LT2 V8 produces 495-horsepower, which combines with an advanced 8-speed dual-clutch transmission for quick shifts and acceleration. The upgraded dual-mode exhaust adds to the snarl of this beast.
That alluring Z51 package adds to the

with equipment like sticky Michelin PS4 performance tires, front brake inlets, a third rear-mounted radiator, and a transmission cooler. An included electronic limited-slip differential helps keep this Corvette going in the right direction as you carve through turns. Sweetening the deal even more is the optional FE4 Magnetic Selective Ride Control system included on this car, providing a smooth ride and razor-sharp handling. There are even adjustable threaded spring seats.

to win the hottest sports cars in America today, a 2021 Z51 Corvette Stingray. Not only that, you’ll be donating to help the National Sprint Car Hall of Fame & Museum, which is the only museum in the entire world dedicated solely to preserving the history of sprint car racing, as well as securing the future of the motorsport for everyone.
